intro: Austroplenckia cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf fern, is a species native to the wet tropical forests of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree trunks and branches in the canopy layer of the rainforest. Its leaves are usually bright green and have a smooth, leathery texture. Austroplenckia cordifolia plays a vital role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and shelter for various small organisms.
